ch.ecma.csta.system

Interface SystemListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.EventListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SystemAdapter

    public interface SystemListener
extends java.util.EventListener
    Initiates an event on a previous System Registration for change in the status of Tlink(s).
    The supported CSTA events include:
    • SystemStatus - disabled
    • SystemStatus - normal
    • SystemRegisterAbort

    Java listeners are used to implement the CSTA concept called monitoring.

    Add a listener to SystemServices using the SystemServices.addSystemStatusListener method. To learn more about using listeners with this API, see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API.

    Version:
    6.2
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.

    • Method Detail

      • systemRegistrationAborted

        void systemRegistrationAborted(SystemRegisterAbort event)
        A callback function which is automatically invoked, on a previously added listener, when the Tlink(s) can no longer be monitored. Possible causes for this include a partial system failure or the TSAPI service has been stopped.

        The registerID is the identifier that was returned in the response to the original SystemRegister request. Note that, when a SystemRegisterAbort event is generated, the original SystemRegister request is automatically torn down.

        Example: 

         String switchName = ""; // empty switchName = all switches
 MySystemListener listener = new MySystemListener();
 syssvcs.addSystemStatusListener(switchName, listener);
 
 private class MySystemListener implements SystemListener {
   public void systemRegistrationAborted(SystemRegisterAbort event) {
     // get the registerID from the event 
     String registerID = event.getSysStatRegisterID();
     System.out.println("Received SystemRegisterAbort event for registerID " + registerID);
   }
 }

      • switchingFunctionCapabililtiesChanged

        void switchingFunctionCapabililtiesChanged(SwFunctionCapsChanged event)
        Not implemented.

      • switchingFunctionDevicesChanged

        void switchingFunctionDevicesChanged(SwFunctionDevicesChanged event)

      • normal

        void normal(SystemStatus event)
        A callback function which is automatically invoked, on a previously added listener, when the status of the Tlink has changed.

        The normal designation indicates that the Tlink to the switch is up and available for use.
        The SystemStatusPrivateData contains the name of the switch associated with the Tlink.

        Example: 

         String switchName = ""; // empty switchName = all switches
 MySystemListener listener = new MySystemListener();
 syssvcs.addSystemStatusListener(switchName, listener);
 
 private class MySystemListener implements SystemListener {
   public void normal(SystemStatus event) {
     // get the switchname from the event 
     if ((event.getExtensions() != null) && 
         (event.getExtensions().getSinglePrivateData() instanceof SystemStatusPrivateData)) {
           String switchName = ((SystemStatusPrivateData)event.getExtensions().getSinglePrivateData()).getSwitchName();
           System.out.println("Received normal event for: " + switchName);
     }
   }
 }

      • disabled

        void disabled(SystemStatus event)
        A callback function which is automatically invoked, on a previously added listener, when the status of the Tlink has changed.

        The disabled designation indicates that the Tlink to the switch is down and unavailable for use.
        The SystemStatusPrivateData contains the name of the switch associated with the Tlink.

        Example: 

         String switchName = ""; // empty switchName = all switches
 MySystemListener listener = new MySystemListener();
 syssvcs.addSystemStatusListener(switchName, listener);
 
 private class MySystemListener implements SystemListener {
   public void disabled(SystemStatus event) {
     // get the switchname from the event 
     if ((event.getExtensions() != null) && 
         (event.getExtensions().getSinglePrivateData() instanceof SystemStatusPrivateData)) {
           String switchName = ((SystemStatusPrivateData)event.getExtensions().getSinglePrivateData()).getSwitchName();
           System.out.println("Received disabled event for: " + switchName);
     }
   }
 }
